title: Ticket #7263: Build RTD with most mature Python bindings available for version
description:
Per site policy, any wheel that is uploaded to PyPI must have a unique version string compared to any prior uploaded wheels. That includes wheels that have been deleted. So if we somehow flub a release to PyPI, the only way to correct this is by uploading a post-release version. (For PyPI, this is signified by adding ".postN" to the version string.) This creates a problem when building documentation for Read The Docs, as our configuration for our documentation build is coded to pip install htcondor==${VERSION_STRING}, which will not grab a post-release version (e.g. ${VERSION_STRING}.post1).

We can do better by taking advantage of =pip='s ability to do logic with version strings. It's valid, for example, to do this:

pip install htcondor>=8.9.3,<8.9.4

This will grab the latest version of the python bindings labeled as part of the 8.9.3 release, even if that includes a post release. I will change our doc build config file to use this logic (>=${CURRENT_VERSION},<${CURRENT_VERSION_MINOR+1}) instead of being coded to look for ${CURRENT_VERSION} and only ${CURRENT_VERSION}.
